article.headline: Wells Fargo names BNY Mellon's Mike Santomassimo as CFO
article.body: Wells Fargo & Co. WFC, named Mike Santomassimo as chief financial officer effective the fall, replacing John Shrewsberry, who is retiring. Santomassimo comes to the role from BNY Mellon, where he has been CFO since 2018. The executive has also done stints at JPMorgan Chase, after starting his career at Smith Barney. Wells shares were up 1.4% premarket, but have fallen 54% in the year to date, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 0.7%.
